Text.Value: *An air of decay hangs over the stooped beggar's form, the same that tainted Mystic Carrion's chambers. This is one of his runaway servants.*
Glad we could get that all straightened out.

EditorData.NodeContext: Relieved this is going no further

Text.Value: And that's the truth. I never lie.
Please. I've begging to do.
That devil, drink! I spent it all.
I will see that it is put to good use. A crate of apples perhaps, or a bottle of wine...
But I haven't heard from him since. Lots of empty houses to check, you see.
Thrumbo had a plan. He was going to find us an abandoned house, somewhere to hide away from Carrion.
Tell me, or spend the rest of your miserable existence waiting for my knife to slit your throat.
You do seem the honest type. I can always tell.
Leave.
Thrumbo? Is he in trouble?
Would a donation to your escape fund reassure you? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
A toast to your kindness! And to Carrion rotting in his grave!
Anything you can spare for a humble beggar?
So, you came through for us in the end. Bravo!
You words say one thing, your face another. I see your lies, so let us dispense with them.
You - you did? Why did you do that, you vicious creature?
An ear, if you're willing to tell me your tale. How did you end up here?
My brothers will be most surprised. I usually return with empty pockets.
Earn your keep, beggar. The rest of us have to.
People were more generous in days gone by.
Attack.
I'll crush your bones to dust, beggar - tell me what you know.
Yes. Um, alms for the poor?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Puts out his hands in a begging gesture
EditorData.NodeContext: Nervous, putting on his best begging voice.

Text.Value: Sniff the area, expanding your senses. Try to identify the smell.
The divine tugs at you. Give in, letting your god flow through you.
Yes, amazing. It's all coming back to me.
You'd really give so much? Thank you.
Have you seen Thrumbo? Mystic Carrion is looking for him.
You'll lose your head in a minute unless you tell me what you know.
Oh, thank you. Such generosity.
I hope wherever Thrumbo's hiding, he's comfortable. Nothing worse than a tight squeeze.
Anything you can lend will be most gratefully received.
Give generously. The man is clearly in desperate need. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])
Toss the beggar some gold. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
Fair enough.
Look closer. See what truly ails this pungent beggar.
I've heard more than one confession in my time. Tell me what you know - it'll lighten the load.
No, no I don't think so. My lips are sealed.
I've hunted monsters, beggar. And I won't hesitate to make you my next kill.
My brothers are depending on me.

EditorData.NodeContext: Proud of the responsibility he's been given

Text.Value: You're protecting your friend, I understand. But you can trust me - I promise.
I am trying! But people haven't the gold to spare, it seems.

EditorData.NodeContext: Doesn't want to believe people are so selfish as to not help him

Text.Value: All behind me, of course. Now I only require the gold for, ah, sustenance.

EditorData.NodeContext: Realises he's given away too much, collecting himself

Text.Value: My thanks to you - your gold will be most gratefully spent.
Afraid I can't help you. I've lost track of him myself. Took a wrong turn somewhere and poof, he was gone.
*An air of decay hangs over the stooped beggar's form. The smell of rot. The smell of death.*
You have to search them thoroughly. Especially the wardrobes - Thrumbo said that's the smartest place to hide.

EditorData.NodeContext: Justifying himself, not realising this is valuable information

Text.Value: A zombie? Oh no - a touch of scurvy, that's all. Nothing a basket of fruit wouldn't solve, could I afford one...

EditorData.NodeContext: Nervous lies, leading into a new, subtler appeal for money

Text.Value: Why? You vicious creature!
*Beneath his ragged clothing, you catch a glimpse of rotten flesh - more than any living being could sustain. This man is a zombie.*
*Your divine power focuses on the beggar - revealing the magic that sustains him. This man is a corpse - a zombie.*
This is important. I need to find your friend - someone's life is at stake.
I'm sorry, I've nothing to spare.
I'm sorry, my purse is rather light at present.
*That smell again - fetid flesh and bone. This is another zombie.*
I'm afraid I've nothing more to tell you. Don't forget to check under the bed!
I didn't know zombies liked their fruit and vegetables?
*You try to focus on the beggar, but the smell is too strong, too nauseating. Perhaps the cause is better left unknown.*
Tell me what you remember, and I might be able to find him for you.
Earn your keep, beggar. The rest of us have to.
Yes. What an excellent idea.
Cut the act. Tell me where Thrumbo is hiding.
Give generously. The man is clearly in desperate need. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])
Thrumbo is dead. I killed him.
Times are hard for us all. But we must persevere!

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to make the player feel better

Text.Value: Toss the beggar some gold. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
Can't a man earn some gold in peace?
A home at last - this calls for a toast! Now where did that old miser keep the wine?
*That smell again - fetid flesh and bone. This is another of Mystic Carrion's runaways.*
*You recall where you've smelled this beggar's rotten musk before - in Mystic Carrion's chambers. This is one of the runaways he seeks.*
Spare a coin for a lost soul?

EditorData.NodeContext: Nervous, putting on his best begging voice.

Text.Value: An ear, if you're willing to tell me your tale. How did you end up here?
Ah. So that's how it is? Very well.

EditorData.NodeContext: Clearing his throat, trying to sound confident dealing with you

Synopsis: Dialog for one of the zombie beggars. After player talks to Father Carrion and has been tasked to kill them, they will react to this and either run to warn their leader, Thrumbo, or confront player. The following states are one-liners and hasmets for each possible quest state (meeting with thrumbo, outside house and inside father carrion's house once fully killed.)
